questions.question_text: What is the worst-case time complexity of the QuickSort algorithm?
questions.explanation: In the worst case, QuickSort performs O(n^2) comparisons when the pivot always results in the most unbalanced partitions.

questions.question_text: Evaluate the integral ∫(2x dx) from 0 to 2.
questions.explanation: The integral of 2x is x^2. Evaluating from 0 to 2, we get 2^2 - 0^2 = 4.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are regular languages?

options.A: Set of all palindromes over {a, b}
options.B: Set of all strings of even length over {a, b}
options.C: Set of all binary strings with an equal number of 0s and 1s
options.D: Set of all strings that do not contain the substring 'aa'

questions.explanation: Option B is regular because even-length strings can be represented by a finite state machine. Option D is also regular because it can be recognized by a DFA.

questions.question_text: Which scheduling algorithm is non-preemptive?
questions.explanation: First Come First Serve (FCFS) is a non-preemptive scheduling algorithm where processes are scheduled in the order of arrival.
The behavior is undefined due to sequence point violation as x is being modified more than once within the same expression.

questions.question_text: What is the probability of getting exactly two heads when flipping three fair coins?
questions.explanation: The sample space is {HHH, HHT, HTH, HTT, THH, THT, TTH, TTT}. The favorable cases are {HHT, HTH, THH}, which is 3 out of 8.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are properties of a binary search tree (BST)?

options.A: The left subtree contains only nodes with values less than the parent node.
options.B: The right subtree contains only nodes with values greater than the parent node.
options.C: There are no duplicate values in the BST.
options.D: The height of a balanced BST is always O(n).

questions.explanation: Options A, B, and C are properties of a BST. Option D is incorrect because the height of a balanced BST is O(log n), not O(n).

questions.question_text: A CPU has a 5-stage pipeline. If a program has 100 instructions, how many cycles will it take to complete execution assuming no stalls?
questions.explanation: The first instruction takes 5 cycles to complete, and each subsequent instruction takes 1 cycle. Total cycles = (n + (k-1)) = 100 + 4 = 104.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about NP-complete problems are true?

options.A: All NP-complete problems are solvable in polynomial time.
options.B: If one NP-complete problem is solved in polynomial time, all NP-complete problems can be solved in polynomial time.
options.C: NP-complete problems are a subset of NP-hard problems.
options.D: The P vs NP question asks whether every problem in P is also in NP.

questions.explanation: NP-complete problems are the hardest problems in NP, and if one can be solved in polynomial time, then all can be. NP-complete problems are also a subset of NP-hard problems.

questions.question_text: A relation R is reflexive if and only if:

options.A: For every element a in the set, (a, a) '/∈' R.
options.B: For every (a, b) in R, (b, a) '∈' R.
options.C: For every (a, b) and (b, c) in R, (a, c) '∈' R.
options.D: For every element a in the set, there exists b such that (a, b) ∈ R.

questions.explanation: A relation R is reflexive if every element is related to itself, meaning (a, a) ∈ R for all elements a.

questions.question_text: What is the number of edges in a complete graph with 'n' vertices?
questions.explanation: A complete graph with 'n' vertices has edges between every pair of vertices. The number of edges is given by n(n-1)/2.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols work at the transport layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: TCP and UDP are transport layer protocols, while IP is a network layer protocol and FTP is an application layer protocol.

questions.question_text: The decimal equivalent of the binary number 1011.01 is:
questions.explanation: 1011 in decimal is 11 and .01 in binary represents 0.25, so the total value is 11.25.

questions.question_text: What is the probability of getting at least one head when flipping two fair coins?
questions.explanation: The probability of getting no heads (only tails) is (1/2 * 1/2 = 1/4). Thus, the probability of getting at least one head is 1 - 1/4 = 3/4 = 0.75.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are NP-complete problems?
questions.explanation: The Travelling Salesman Problem, SAT, and Subset Sum Problem are all NP-complete problems, while Dijkstra’s algorithm runs in polynomial time.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are correct regarding AVL trees?

options.A: AVL tree is a self-balancing binary search tree.
options.B: The height difference between left and right subtrees is at most 2.
options.C: AVL trees provide better search performance than unbalanced binary search trees.
options.D: Insertion and deletion in an AVL tree take O(log n) time.

questions.explanation: AVL trees are self-balancing BSTs with a height difference of at most 1 between left and right subtrees. They provide O(log n) search, insertion, and deletion.

questions.question_text: Which of the following sorting algorithms is NOT stable?
questions.explanation: Quick Sort is not a stable sorting algorithm since it does not guarantee the relative order of equal elements.

questions.question_text:
What is the value of the determinant of the following matrix?

| 2  3 |
| 4  5 |
Which of the following statements about context-free grammars (CFGs) are true?

options.C: Context-free languages can be recognized by pushdown automata.

questions.explanation: Regular languages are a subset of context-free languages, pushdown automata recognize context-free languages, and CFGs can generate palindromes.

questions.question_text: Which CPU scheduling algorithm minimizes the average waiting time?
questions.explanation: Shortest Job First (SJF) minimizes the average waiting time by executing shorter jobs first.

questions.question_text: How many unique binary search trees (BSTs) can be formed with 4 distinct nodes?
questions.explanation: The number of unique BSTs is given by the Catalan number C(n) = (2n)! / ((n+1)! * n!), which for n=4 is 14.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are advantages of RAID-5?
questions.explanation: RAID-5 provides fault tolerance and improved read performance due to striping with parity, but write speeds are slower due to parity calculations.

questions.question_text: What is the time complexity of finding an element in an unbalanced binary search tree?
questions.explanation: In the worst case, an unbalanced BST degenerates into a linked list, making search operations O(n).

questions.question_text: How many different Hamiltonian cycles exist in a complete graph with 5 vertices?
questions.explanation: For a complete graph with n vertices, Hamiltonian cycles = (n-1)! / 2. For n=5, (4!)/2 = 12.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols work at the transport layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: TCP and UDP operate at the transport layer, while IP is at the network layer and FTP at the application layer.

questions.question_text: What is the equivalent hexadecimal representation of the binary number 101011?
questions.explanation: 101011 in binary is equivalent to 2B in hexadecimal.

questions.question_text: Which of the following SQL statements are correct?
questions.explanation: SQL uses SELECT, DELETE, and ALTER TABLE, but 'REMOVE' is not a valid SQL statement.

questions.question_text: A Turing machine with infinite tape and finite states can solve which class of problems?
questions.explanation: A Turing machine can recognize all recursively enumerable languages but not necessarily decide them.

questions.question_text: Which of the following sorting algorithms has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort has an average-case time complexity of O(n log n), which is better than O(n^2) sorting algorithms like Bubble Sort and Insertion Sort.

questions.question_text: What is the probability of drawing a red card from a standard deck of 52 playing cards?
questions.explanation: There are 26 red cards (hearts and diamonds) in a deck of 52. Probability = 26/52 = 0.5.

questions.question_text: Which of the following languages can be recognized by a pushdown automaton?
questions.explanation: A pushdown automaton (PDA) can recognize context-free languages, but not all recursively enumerable languages.

questions.question_text: Which of the following page replacement algorithms suffers from Belady’s anomaly?
questions.explanation: Belady's anomaly occurs in FIFO page replacement, where increasing the number of frames may increase page faults.

questions.question_text: How many spanning trees can be formed from a complete graph with 5 vertices?
questions.explanation: The number of spanning trees of a complete graph with n vertices is given by Cayley’s formula: n^(n-2). For n = 5, it's 5^3 = 125.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols operate at the application layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: HTTP, FTP, and DNS are application-layer protocols, whereas TCP operates at the transport layer.

questions.question_text: What is the binary representation of the decimal number 45?
questions.explanation: The decimal number 45 converts to 101101 in binary.

questions.question_text: Which of the following SQL operations delete all rows from a table but retain its structure?
questions.explanation: TRUNCATE removes all rows but retains the table structure, whereas DELETE removes specific rows, and DROP removes the entire table.

questions.question_text: Which of the following scheduling algorithms can lead to starvation?
questions.explanation: SJF and Priority Scheduling can lead to starvation if short or high-priority processes dominate execution.

questions.question_text: What is the result of the bitwise AND operation between 25 (11001) and 14 (01110)?
questions.explanation: 25 (11001) AND 14 (01110) results in 00001000, which is 8 in decimal.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are true for a deadlock to occur?
questions.explanation: Deadlock occurs when Mutual Exclusion, Hold and Wait, and Circular Wait conditions hold. Preemption prevents deadlock.

questions.question_text: Which of the following graph traversal techniques use a queue data structure?
questions.explanation: Breadth-First Search (BFS) uses a queue, while DFS uses a stack (or recursion).

questions.question_text: How many different binary search trees can be formed with 5 distinct nodes?
questions.explanation: The number of unique BSTs is given by the Catalan number: C(n) = (2n)! / ((n+1)! * n!). For n=5, the result is 42.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are NP-complete problems?
questions.explanation: Hamiltonian Cycle, TSP, and Subset Sum are NP-complete, while MST can be solved in polynomial time.

questions.question_text: Which of the following sorting algorithms has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.explanation: Quick Sort has an average-case time complexity of O(n log n), which is better than O(n²) for Bubble, Insertion, and Selection Sort.

questions.question_text: What is the number of simple graphs possible with 4 vertices?
questions.explanation: The number of simple graphs possible with n vertices is 2^(n(n-1)/2). For n=4, the result is 2^(4×3/2) = 2^6 = 64.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about context-free grammars (CFGs) are correct?

options.B: All context-free languages can be recognized by a DFA.
options.D: CFGs can be used to model arithmetic expressions.

questions.explanation: CFGs generate all regular languages and some non-regular languages. They are also used in parsing arithmetic expressions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following memory management techniques leads to external fragmentation?
questions.explanation: Segmentation leads to external fragmentation as variable-sized partitions leave unused spaces.

questions.question_text: Convert the decimal number 2024 into hexadecimal.
questions.explanation: The decimal number 2024 converts to hexadecimal as 7E8.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols are used in the application layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: HTTP, SMTP, and DNS are application-layer protocols, whereas TCP operates at the transport layer.

questions.question_text: How many different Binary Search Trees (BSTs) can be formed with 5 distinct nodes?
questions.explanation: The number of unique BSTs with n nodes is given by the Catalan number: C(n) = (2n)! / ((n+1)! * n!). For n=5, the result is 42.

questions.question_text: Which of the following SQL commands are used for Data Definition Language (DDL)?
questions.explanation: CREATE and ALTER belong to DDL, whereas UPDATE and DELETE belong to DML.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are true about pipelining in processors?
questions.explanation: Pipelining increases throughput but does not reduce individual instruction execution time. It may cause hazards.

questions.question_text: What is the worst-case time complexity of searching an element in a hash table with chaining?
questions.explanation: In the worst case, all elements hash to the same bucket, leading to O(n) complexity.

questions.question_text: What is the time complexity of Prim's algorithm using an adjacency matrix with a priority queue?
questions.explanation: Using an adjacency matrix, Prim's algorithm runs in O(n²) time complexity.

questions.question_text: How many different spanning trees can be formed from a complete graph with 5 vertices?
questions.explanation: For a complete graph with n vertices, the number of spanning trees is given by Cayley’s formula: T(n) = n^(n-2). For n=5, the result is 5^3 = 125.

questions.question_text: Which of the following security mechanisms are used for authentication?
questions.explanation: Authentication mechanisms include biometrics and passwords, while firewalls and encryption are security measures for protection and confidentiality.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about AVL trees are correct?

options.A: An AVL tree is a self-balancing binary search tree.
options.B: The height difference between left and right subtrees cannot exceed 1.
options.C: Insertion in an AVL tree may require rebalancing via rotations.
options.D: AVL trees always have a height of O(n).

questions.explanation: AVL trees maintain balance by ensuring the height difference is at most 1, and rotations are used for rebalancing.

questions.question_text: What is the minimum number of page frames required to prevent thrashing in a system using the Least Recently Used (LRU) page replacement algorithm?
questions.explanation: The minimum number of page frames needed to prevent thrashing is determined by the working set of a process, typically at least 4 in practical scenarios.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are true about the RSA encryption algorithm?

options.A: It is an asymmetric key encryption algorithm.
options.B: It is based on the difficulty of prime factorization.
options.C: It requires the sender and receiver to share a secret key.
options.D: It is used in digital signatures.

questions.explanation: RSA is an asymmetric algorithm based on prime factorization and is used in encryption and digital signatures.

questions.question_text: Convert the decimal number 156 into its binary equivalent.
questions.explanation: 156 in decimal converts to 10011100 in binary.

questions.question_text: Which of the following scheduling algorithms suffer from starvation?
questions.explanation: SJF and Priority Scheduling can cause starvation as shorter jobs and higher-priority tasks may continuously preempt others.

questions.question_text: Which of the following languages are regular?

options.A: Set of all strings over {a, b} where the number of a's is even.
options.B: Set of all palindromes over {a, b}.
options.C: Set of all binary strings where the number of 0s is equal to the number of 1s.
options.D: Set of all strings that do not contain 'aa' as a substring.

questions.explanation: Regular languages can be represented using finite automata. Palindromes and equal number of 0s and 1s require a PDA.

questions.question_text: What is the subnet mask for a Class C network with 4 subnets?
questions.explanation: For 4 subnets in a Class C network, we need 2 bits for subnetting, leading to a mask of 255.255.255.192.

questions.question_text: How many different binary trees can be formed with 3 labeled nodes?
questions.explanation: The number of unique binary trees with n nodes is given by the Catalan number C(n) = (2n)! / ((n+1)! * n!), which for n=3 is 5.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols use the sliding window technique?
questions.explanation: Go-Back-N and Selective Repeat use the sliding window technique for flow control.

questions.question_text: What is the decimal equivalent of the hexadecimal number 2F?
questions.explanation: 2F in hexadecimal is 2×16 + 15 = 32 + 15 = 47 in decimal.

questions.question_text: Which of the following SQL operations modify the structure of a table?
questions.explanation: ALTER TABLE and DROP TABLE modify the structure of a table, whereas UPDATE modifies data, and TRUNCATE removes all rows.

questions.question_text: A DFA (Deterministic Finite Automaton) can recognize which class of languages?
questions.explanation: A DFA recognizes regular languages, which can be represented by regular expressions and finite state machines.

questions.question_text: The number of connected components in an undirected graph with 10 vertices and 8 edges is at least:
questions.explanation: If a graph with 10 vertices has 8 edges, the minimum number of connected components is 3, assuming the edges are distributed optimally.
